POST.POST_BODY: Hello,I'm diabetic patient,its label  Glucose(F) is 9.76 mol/L and Glucose (2ABF) is 17.32 mol/L.I already get hepatitis vaccine 6 year ago.I'm 28 years old. my ALT(SGPT) IS  129.50 U/L , S.CREATININE IS  1.0 mg/dL  and S.TSH IS 2.62 micro IU/ml. is it dangerous ALT? how can I get its normal range? please give me proper treatment solution.

RESPONSE.RESPONSE_BODY:
Hello,
if your fasting glucose is 9.76 (175), and your 2 hours after eating is 17.32 (311), the your blood sugar levels are way too high.  Target fasting is ideally < 5.5 (100) (better in the 3.8 - 5 (70-90) range) and your post eating should be < 7.7 (140) (better in the 4.4 - 6.6 (80-120) range).  Suggest you work with your doctor to get better control of your diabetes, which will also be beneficial to your liver.    Be sure to avoid high fructose corn syrup, and reduce carbs and sugars - to help reduce the stress on your liver(and these will also help with blood sugar management).
